Anyway, Kaspersky will continue to identify it as a threat because of the way it is coded, and the actions it performs. It works with Kaspersky Internet Security 2010 v 9.0.0.736 (still).

To help those having trouble:

ALWAYS keep the Trial-Reset Program in a .rar archive. Go download Winrar (google it, it's free). If you keep it in an archive, the regular scanner will not identify it unless you manually scan the archive. This prevents file deletion.

-----------------

If you continue to have trouble with this, I suggest you go back to the main page of this site, and search for Kaspersky Internet Security 2010, and look among the torrents for ChattChitto's KIS 2010 keys. They work =)
DONT USE FOR 2011
